title: scraps
author: scraps
content: I mined many many moons ago, and i had a small amount still in my mining account which i thought one day i will make use of.Well, After being gox'd, coss'd, hacked, scammed by binance and more, including several individual people along the way and everything in between,now is the time i actually need to make use of it as i'm down to literal pocket change irl and i have been hit with some bills and rent increase i cant afford.Is there any way DeepBit is still accessible somehow? or at least, contactable?  Seems for me, crypto has been nothing but a curse. I've lost everything i've ever collected, and put in thousands of my own money thats just vanished. I really need to get these scraps from my old mining account, without it i'm pretty rekt. please help.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: So you have mine coins on that pool called Deepbit?I searched a bit and I found deepbit.org it seems it's not a pool but an exchange however, I saw an article on Bitcoin Wiki according to them deepbit is an old mining pool and they have an account here on the forum but the problem is they are no longer active since 2014 which means DeepBit was dead long time ago and it's impossible to reach them. DeepBit Forum Profile here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=43544Bitcoin Wiki source: https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/DeepBitTheir site is still alive but it offers gaming strategies it looks like gambling I'm pretty sure the current owner is not the owner of the old Deepbit pool.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: It's too bad that you didn't think of your mining rewards earlier. DeepBit was indeed a bitcoin mining pool back in the day. There are snapshots of the site on Wayback Machine that show how it used to look. Here are two examples from 2011 and 2013. The last capture I could access dates back to 2015. I am afraid that you won't have much luck in finding and getting in touch with the people who used to be in charge of this mining pool.

comments.author: james246henry
comments.created_time: December 23, 2024, 08:49:16 AMLast edit: December 24, 2024, 04:21:43 AM by james246henry
comments.body: Quote from: scraps on August 09, 2024, 09:55:13 PMI mined many many moons ago, and i had a small amount still in my mining account which i thought one day i will make use of.Well, After being gox'd, coss'd, hacked, scammed by binance and more, including several individual people along the way and everything in between,now is the time i actually need to make use of it as i'm down to literal pocket change irl and i have been hit with some bills and rent increase i cant afford.Is there any way DeepBit is still accessible somehow? or at least, contactable?  Seems for me, crypto has been nothing but a curse. I've lost everything i've ever collected, and put in thousands of my own money thats just vanished. I really need to get these scraps from my old mining account, without it i'm pretty rekt. please help.Hello,It’s tough when it feels like crypto has been more of a curse than a blessing. Given that DeepBit was closed long ago, it's unlikely there’s any current access or contact available. ncedcloudlogin.comBest Regards,James Henry

comments.author: lisa52smith
comments.created_time: December 30, 2024, 11:40:42 AMLast edit: December 31, 2024, 05:21:49 AM by lisa52smith
comments.body: I'm really sorry to hear about all the difficulties you've faced with your crypto assets. Unfortunately, DeepBit, the mining pool you used, has been inactive since 2014. There's no known way to access or contact them anymore.Given your situation, it might be worth consulting with a professional cryptocurrency recovery service or legal advisor who specializes in crypto assets. They might have more resources and knowledge to help you recover your funds Tell CulversI hope this helps, and I wish you the best of luck in resolving this issue.

comments.author: betswift
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on August 09, 2024, 11:45:04 PMSo you have mine coins on that pool called Deepbit?I searched a bit and I found deepbit.org it seems it's not a pool but an exchange however, I saw an article on Bitcoin Wiki according to them deepbit is an old mining pool and they have an account here on the forum but the problem is they are no longer active since 2014 which means DeepBit was dead long time ago and it's impossible to reach them. DeepBit Forum Profile here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=43544Bitcoin Wiki source: https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/DeepBitTheir site is still alive but it offers gaming strategies it looks like gambling I'm pretty sure the current owner is not the owner of the old Deepbit pool. The problem seems to be lost due to time passing by naturally. Unfortunate. Last activity on the pool was reported on November 28, 2013, as for the wiki of Deepbit.And the person who supported their thread there was last active on March of 2014.

comments.author: DediRock
comments.body: DeepBit mining pool appears to be inactive and likely defunct, with no official updates or new operating name. Unfortunately, without access to their platform or contact details, recovering funds might be impossible. I'm sorry you're going through this—consider seeking help from crypto recovery experts or communities that may offer guidance.

comments.author: sara96brown
comments.created_time: December 31, 2024, 12:23:06 PMLast edit: January 01, 2025, 04:55:09 AM by sara96brown
comments.body: Quote from: scraps on August 09, 2024, 09:55:13 PMI mined many many moons ago, and i had a small amount still in my mining account which i thought one day i will make use of.Well, After being gox'd, coss'd, hacked, scammed by binance and more, including several individual people along the way and everything in between,now is the time i actually need to make use of it as i'm down to literal pocket change irl and i have been hit with some bills and rent increase i cant afford.Is there any way DeepBit is still accessible somehow? or at least, contactable?  Seems for me, crypto has been nothing but a curse. I've lost everything i've ever collected, and put in thousands of my own money thats just vanished. I really need to get these scraps from my old mining account, without it i'm pretty rekt. please help Click HereI'm really sorry to hear about all the difficulties you've faced with your crypto assets. Unfortunately, DeepBit, the mining pool you used, has been defunct since 2014. This means there's no way to access your account or retrieve any remaining funds through the original platform.

comments.author: FortuneFollower
comments.body: Quote from: DediRock on December 30, 2024, 01:51:29 PMDeepBit mining pool appears to be inactive and likely defunct, with no official updates or new operating name. Unfortunately, without access to their platform or contact details, recovering funds might be impossible. I'm sorry you're going through this—consider seeking help from crypto recovery experts or communities that may offer guidance.Don't think there are good boys in such "communities" to start with.Better just to leave the prospects.

comments.author: DediRock
comments.body: DeepBit appears inactive, and recovery might be unlikely. Try checking old email records or blockchain for wallet access. Sorry to hear about your losses—stay strong.
